Crime_Name: Refugee Claim Based on Persecution and Domestic Violence
Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in concluding that the applicant could benefit from state protection or an Internal Flight Alternative (IFA)
Application_Facts: Applicant faced domestic violence and persecution due to her sexual orientation; attempts to seek police protection were dismissed; systemic insensitivity towards domestic violence in Saint-Vincent and the Grenadines
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board’s decision denying refugee protection
Court_Ruling: Application for judicial review allowed; case remanded for redetermination
Claimant_Status: LGBTQ+ individual fleeing domestic violence and persecution
Defendant_Behavior: State authorities dismissed complaints and failed to protect the applicant
Assessment_Factor: Country conditions regarding domestic violence and LGBTQ+ rights
Procedural_Issue: Standard of review applied by the court on state protection and IFA findings
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's account of abuse and lack of police response deemed credible
Evidence_Used: Country condition reports on treatment of women and LGBTQ+ individuals
Legislative efforts in Saint-Vincent and the Grenadines
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 96 and Section 97 of IRPA (refugee definition)
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution due to membership in a particular social group (women facing domestic violence and LGBTQ+ individuals)
Evidence_Assessed: Systemic failure in protecting victims of domestic violence
Insufficiency of legislative reforms without enforcement
Governing_Rule: A claimant must establish a well-founded fear of persecution and lack of effective state protection
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Board relied on existence of laws rather than their enforcement
Overlooked interconnectedness of islands undermining IFA
Outcome: Judicial review granted; matter referred back for redetermination
Harm_Assessment: Serious harm through domestic violence and societal persecution due to sexual orientation
Cause_Description: Applicant fled Saint-Vincent and the Grenadines due to domestic violence and persecution based on her sexual orientation
Evidence_Handling: Court found Board failed to properly assess effectiveness of legal framework and practical access to protection
Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 96 of IRPA – failure to recognize well-founded fear of persecution
Evidence_Issues: Disregard of evidence showing ineffective implementation of protective laws
Legal_Provision: Section 96, IRPA – Definition of Convention refugee
Evidence_Assessment: Board’s conclusions on state protection and IFA were not supported by the evidence
Decision_Rationale: Existence of laws does not equate to effective protection; IFA not viable in small island nation with widespread discrimination
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient weight given to lived experiences and structural barriers
